unnormalised: Subject: Air Quality - Kitna Badla Hai? (How Much Has It Changed?)
normalised: Subject: Air Quality - How Much Has It Changed?

unnormalised: So, air quality, right? It's something we all breathe (literally!), but do we *really* think about it enough? Especially here in India?
normalised: So, air quality, right? It's something we all breathe (literally!), but do we *really* think about it enough? Especially here in India?

unnormalised: I remember growing up in Delhi (late 90s, early 2000s), and smog was just...normal. You'd see it every winter, especially around Diwali time on 24/10/2022. Now, I'm in Bangalore, and while it's generally better, you still get those days where the air quality index (AQI) spikes, particularly after the burning of crop stubble up north.
normalised: I remember growing up in Delhi (late nineties, early two thousands), and smog was just...normal. You'd see it every winter, especially around Diwali time on twenty fourth october two thousand and twenty two. Now, I'm in Bangalore, and while it's generally better, you still get those days where the air quality index (A Q I) spikes, particularly after the burning of crop stubble up north.

unnormalised: Has anyone else noticed a difference in their city over the years? I've been trying to do my bit by using public transport (BMTC rocks!), but is it enough? I read an article from TERI (The Energy and Resources Institute) last year that talked about the long-term health impacts of poor air quality, even exposure as low as 50 µg/m³. It really freaked me out.

unnormalised: I also remember when the Supreme Court mandated the conversion of Delhi's public transport to CNG around 2001-2002, and there was some improvement. However, emissions from vehicles are still high. Has anyone read about the new BS-VI emission norms? Are they working?
normalised: I also remember when the Supreme Court mandated the conversion of Delhi's public transport to C N G around two thousand one to two thousand two, and there was some improvement. However, emissions from vehicles are still high. Has anyone read about the new B S-V I emission norms? Are they working?

unnormalised: And what about those air purifiers everyone's buying? Are they actually effective, or just a band-aid solution? I’m also worried about my grandmother in Kolkata. Her lungs are already weak at 78 years old, and I know the air quality there can be pretty bad sometimes, especially during rush hour (say, around 09:00 hrs).

unnormalised: What practical steps can we all take – besides just complaining on social media! – to improve air quality in our cities? Any thoughts or suggestions are welcome. I'm genuinely curious to hear everyone's experiences and insights. Maybe we can all learn something from each other, even if it's just knowing you aren't alone in this concern!
